alert.note: Alert for Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 2:17PM EDT until June 06 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Washington County in east central New York... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 216 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Greenwich, or 9 miles southwest of Salem, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Greenwich, Ash Grove, Shushan, Clarks Mills, Battenville, Center Falls, Archdale, East Greenwich, Rexleigh, Middle Falls, Eagleville, Anaquassacook, North Cambridge, Coila, North Greenwich, Bald Mountain and Spraguetown. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
